iati-activity.title: Support to Management Capacity Programme (MCP)
iati-activity.description: TO SUPPORT A NEW GOVERNMENT OF AFGHANISTAN (GOA) SCHEME TO ENABLE MINISTRIES AND ?AGENCIES TO RECRUIT ADDITIONAL QUALIFIED STAFF TO LINE MANAGEMENT POSITIONS IN ORDER TO ?IMPROVE PERFORMANCE IN KEY FUNCTIONAL AREAS SUCH AS HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, ?PROCUREMENT AND POLICY FORMULATION. THE MANAGEMENT CAPACITY PROGRAMME (MCP) ?IS FUNDED THROUGH THE ARTF, AND MANAGED DIRECTLY BY THE INDEPENDENT ?ADMINISTRATIVE REFORM AND CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION (IARCSC). MCP WILL ALSO ?PROVIDE SUPPORT TO THE IARCSC TO ENSURE EFFICIENT MANAGEMENT OF THE PROGRAMME. ?THE TOTAL ARTF COST OF MCP IS $30M OVER THREE YEARS

iati-activity.title: Support to the Office of the Senior Minister
iati-activity.description: To improve governance in Afghanistan by providing a team of international and national advisers for two years to support the Office of the Senior Minister who is responsible for coordinating the governance reform agenda. Ultimately such reforms will improve how Afghan public institutions are managed. This contributes towards building a viable and stable Afghan state that is able to deliver improved services to its people and reduce poverty.

iati-activity.title: Emergency Food and Nutrition Support
iati-activity.description: To provide food security and nutrition support to highly vulnerable people in Afghanistan, who are affected by conflict or disaster. This will benefit around 350,000 households who will be supported with food aid, and treat 92,000 acutely malnourished children, and 95,000 pregnant/lactating women with supplementary feeding. This intervention contributes to UK’s global commitment to MDG 4 (Reducing child mortality) and MDG 5 (Improving maternal health).

iati-activity.title: Enhancing Legal and Electoral Capacity for Tomorrow Programme (ELECT II)
iati-activity.description: To strengthen the capacity of the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC) so that it is able to help ensure effective and well organised Afghan-led elections in 2014/15, to improve the voter registration system in order to increase public confidence in electoral bodies and thereby reduce the potential for fraud; to increase female participation in elections and improve public confidence in election results and to ensure people have a stronger stake in the government they have voted for.

iati-activity.title: Support to demining (Phase 2)
iati-activity.description: To increase economic growth and reduce poverty in Afghanistan, by demining up to 4.3square kms of arable and up to 14square km of grazing land. This will make the entire province of Herat clear of mines by 2018, benefitting up to 71,500 people by securing their safety of and increasing their livelihood opportunities.
